channel.title: Buying A Computer
channel.description:
I'm in dire need of a new computer. The one I use is used by everyone in the house. I just want my own one.
I was looking at some Dells (I know they are bashed a lot...Don't know why). They all seem pretty nice, but I'm looking for something at around £400-500 ($1100 abouts max). I'd prefer to buy the computer as a whole, not build it.
Anything good (That can run a few games (Battlefield 2, CS:S) doesn't have to be uber amazing) and that comes with XP, not Vista.
These would be min specs I think: 1 GB RAM CPU 2.5 GHz Hard drive 100GB+ Decent cooling
If the retailer is based in the UK, that's best for me.
Thanks guys.
P.S. - I'm not looking for Alienware, or any hardcore gaming computer like that. I'm looking for a bog standard desktop computer I can do school work on, play a few games and loads up with some software (Some being a little bit resource hogging but not too much).
P.S.S - Nothing from PCWorld thank you :P

item.title: Buying A Computer
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Moparisthebest:

May I ask why you don’t want to build a computer? You can save at least 75% of the price by doing it and it won’t take you over 1-2 hours depending on how fast you work. It is not complicated at all, if you ever built Lego’s when you were smaller then you have already developed sufficient skills to snap together a computer.

Hah It’s not the fact I don’t feel I could, it’s the fact that when I get annoyed, I get very annoyed. Also, I know I’d make some stupid mistake that would completely ruin the computer.

My cousin has some decent contacts in the computer industry, so in fact, it would be cheaper for him to buy me the parts than to buy them myself.
